item.description:
Kettletown was reportedly bought by the white settlers from the Indians for a brass kettle. Man made Lake Zoar was constructed for hydroelectric generation and provides a beach area. The trails go to scenic overlooks on the hills.

This will be an easy walk of about 3 miles with some uphill climbs. Then we will return by the Pomperaug Trail. Social walking pace. We will be out for 2 to 3 hours or as fate may have it. Afterwards we will have a picnic lunch at the beach. Rain cancels. Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

Location: 1400 Georges Hill Rd, Southbury, CT.
http://maps.google.co...
